title: Serum Osmolality/Osmolarity
desc: The Serum Osmolality/Osmolarity calculates expected serum osmolarity, for comparison to measured osmolarity to detect unmeasured compounds in the serum.

orgreference.text: Purssell RA, Pudek M, Brubacher J, Abu-Laban RB.Derivation and validation of a formula to calculate the contribution of ethanol to the osmolal gap.Ann Emerg Med 2001;38 (6): 653â€“9.doi:10.1067/mem.2001.119455. PMID 11719745.

other_refer.text: Glasser L, et. al. Serum Osmolality and its applicability to drug overdose. Am. J. Clin. Path. 1973; 60:695.

data.evidence:
Traditional equation:

Serum osmolality, US units = (2 × Na + (BUN / 2.8) + (glucose / 18) + (ethanol / 4.6)

Purssell et al equation:

Serum osmolality, US units = (2 × Na + (BUN / 2.8) + (glucose / 18) + (ethanol / 3.7)

Note: the range displayed in the calculator uses the equations above.

Osmolal gap equation:

Osmolal gap = measured serum osm - calculated serum osm

Note: the osmolal gap displayed in the calculator uses the Pursell et al equation.
data.facts: If values are in SI units, these are already molar (mmol/L for example), so these do not need to be divided by their molecular weight.

inputs.name: ethanol
inputs.tips_en: Enter 80, not 0.08 if in US units (mg/dL)
